content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-265-07-A |Item_parent=Urinary lithiasis |Item_parent_short=Urinary lithiasis |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the clinical aspects of simple renal colic |Description=Pain, radiation, nausea... |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Romain Boissier |Order=7}} Renal colic is said to be "simple" when it occurs : * without fever or chills, * no biological renal failure or oligo-anuria * and that it subsides with analgesic treatment with NSAIDs.

question.title: What are the characteristics of simple renal colic?
question.description: Renal colic is said to be "simple" when it occurs under which conditions?

option_a.title: with fever or chills, and no response to analgesic treatment
option_a.description: Option A: This option describes a scenario where renal colic is not simple.

option_b.title: without fever or chills, and with biological renal failure or oligo-anuria
option_b.description: Option B: This option describes a scenario where renal colic is not simple.

option_c.title: with fever or chills, and that it subsides with analgesic treatment with NSAIDs
option_c.description: Option C: This option describes a scenario where renal colic is not simple.

option_d.title: without fever or chills, no biological renal failure or oligo-anuria, and that it subsides with analgesic treatment with NSAIDs
option_d.description: Option D: This option describes the correct scenario for simple renal colic.

correct_option.title: D
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the option
